articles.author: MATT BROWN and MICHELLE L. PRICE
articles.description: CHICAGO (AP) — Donald Trump falsely suggested Kamala Harris had misled voters about her race as the former president appeared before the National Association of Black Journalists in Chicago Wednesday in an interview that quickly turned hostile.
articles.title: Donald Trump falsely suggests Kamala Harris misled voters about her race

articles.author: ZEKE MILLER and COLLEEN LONG
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — It was President Joe Biden's first public appearance since he dropped out of the race, and the applause for him from the crowded auditorium in Austin, Texas, just kept going.
articles.title: Biden is adjusting to a new reality, coming to terms with his departure from 2024 race

articles.author: ABBY SEWELL
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — Hamas' top political leader was killed Wednesday by a predawn airstrike in the Iranian capital, Iran and the militant group said, blaming Israel for a shock assassination that risked escalating into an all-out regional war.
articles.title: Hamas' top political leader is killed in Iran in strike that risks triggering all-out regional war

articles.author: BASSEM MROUE and TIA GOLDENBERG
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — The Lebanese militant group Hezbollah confirmed Wednesday that Israel killed a top commander after a rare strike in Beirut.The Iran-backed group said earlier that Fouad Shukur was in the building during the attack on Tuesday, and they were searching for him in the rubble to determine his fate.
articles.title: Hezbollah confirms that a top commander was killed in Israeli strike in Beirut

articles.author: ELLEN KNICKMEYER and LARRY NEUMEISTER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Khalid Sheikh Mohammed, accused as the mastermind of al-Qaida’s Sept. 11, 2001, attacks on the United States, has agreed to plead guilty, the Defense Department said Wednesday.
articles.title: Khalid Sheikh Mohammed, accused as the main plotter of 9/11 attacks, agrees to plead guilty

articles.author: REGINA GARCIA CANO and GISELA SALOMON
articles.description: CARACAS, Venezuela (AP) — President Nicolás Maduro on Wednesday asked Venezuela’s Supreme Court to conduct an audit of the presidential election after opposition leaders disputed his claim of victory, drawing criticism from foreign observers who said the court is too close to the government to produce an independent review.
articles.title: Venezuela's Maduro asks Supreme Court to audit the presidential election, but observers cry foul

articles.author: AUDREY McAVOY
articles.description: HONOLULU (AP) — The parties involved in Lahaina wildfire lawsuits against the state of Hawaii, Maui County and utilities are close to a global settlement of claims that will be worth a little over $4 billion, Gov.
articles.title: Hawaii Gov. Josh Green tells AP a $4 billion settlement for 2023 Maui wildfire could come next week

articles.author: JAMEY KEATEN
articles.description: GENEVA (AP) — The U.N. human rights office issued a report Wednesday saying Palestinians detained by Israeli authorities since the Oct.
articles.title: UN report says Palestinians detained by Israeli authorities since Oct. 7 faced torture, mistreatment

articles.author: JAMES POLLARD and THALIA BEATY
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — MrBeast, YouTube's biggest star and a philanthropic force with nearly unrivaled influence among young audiences, acknowledged Wednesday that he used “inappropriate language” in his early online days, as numerous controversies bubbled up around him and a former collaborator.
articles.title: MrBeast, YouTube's biggest star, acknowledges past 'inappropriate language' as controversies swirl

articles.description: NANTERRE, France (AP) — Katie Ledecky has tied one of swimming's most impressive records. Chances are, she'll have it all to herself by the time she completes the Paris Olympics.
articles.title: What's next for Katie Ledecky? Another race and a relay as she goes for more records
